#Text=The San Antonio Spurs ( 14 - 3 ) obliterated the Atlanta Hawks ( 11 - 8 ) 108 - 88 on Saturday .
#Text=The Spurs won the second quarter 31 - 12 and the game never got close after that .
#Text=The final score is actually closer than the actual result , as the Spurs led by 30 points at times in the fourth quarter .
#Text=Coach Gregg Popovich showed apprentice Mike Budenholzer why he is king and it was definitely a disappointing homecoming for Coach Bud .
#Text=The difference in the game was as simple as shooting , as the Spurs shot 53 percent from long distance while the Hawks shot just 23 percent .
#Text=San Antonio was also nearly perfect from the charity stripe , going 19 - for - 20 while Atlanta went just 8 - for - 13 .
#Text=The Hawks have not won in San Antonio since 1997 and have now lost 18 - straight games there .
#Text=This was one of the worst games that the Hawks have played all season .
#Text=No starter scored more than 10 points and none of them had more than four assists .
#Text=That 's extremely rare for a team like the Hawks and it 's a great indication of how dominant the Spurs were on Saturday .
#Text=Eight players came off the bench for Atlanta , but nobody played spectacularly .
#Text=This is just one of those games where the Hawks have to tip their cap to a better team and move on to the next game .
#Text=Unfortunately for them , they have to play the equally potent Oklahoma City Thunder in their next game on Monday .
#Text=The Spurs came into this game 80 at home with some dominant results and they left with an even better resume .
#Text=San Antonio dominated nearly every significant statistic and the result was decided well before the final whistle .
#Text=Tim Duncan had a renaissance game of sorts , as he tallied 10 points , 17 rebounds and four assists in the victory .
#Text=The Spurs are quietly having a great start to the season , but they 'll be happy to fly under - the - radar once again .
#Text=San Antonio will travel to take on the Chicago Bulls in their next scheduled game on Monday .
